title: Historic department store chain to close outlet location in weeks - just 3 years after surviving bankruptcy | The US Sun
text:
BOSSES of a department store chain have confirmed that one of its outlet locations will close its doors in weeks. The Belk Outlet store in a Charlottesville, Virginia , shopping mall – located around 70 miles from the state capital, Richmond – will shut up shop in January.
2 A Belk Outlet store in Virginia is to close Credit: WVIR-TV 2 A crafts retailer will replace the chain once it closes (stock) Credit: Getty It is just one of more than a dozen outlet stores the company, founded in 1888, has in its portfolio.
Execs have confirmed that the closure is in line with the store’s lease deal expiring, as reported by the NBC affiliate WVIR-TV .
Randy Dell, the regional vice president for Belk Outlets, stressed the store was always temporary.
A Hobby Lobby store is to replace the Belk Outlet once it closes.

The closure of the outlet store comes just three years after the chain exited bankruptcy .
Chiefs filed for bankruptcy in February 2021 and were able to clear around $450 million worth of debt.
The company entered and exited bankruptcy on the same day.

The locations sell clearance goods from more traditional Belk department stores.
However, outlet stores do not sell jewelry or beauty items.
Shoppers cannot return items once they’ve been sold.

The chain’s first Outlet location was in Greeneville, Tennessee, which opened in 2023.
Bosses opened the brand’s first Outlet store in North Carolina in September of this year.
"This is a fantastic opportunity for customers to shop a large range of designer and high-end national brands at additional savings,” Don Hendricks, the company’s CEO, said.
“Customers across our footprint are loving the Belk Outlet offerings, so we're looking forward to adding this new location."
The Outlet location is featured on the second level of the chain’s department store in the Northlake Mall in Charlotte, North Carolina.
Belk is one of the oldest department store chains in the US and has a history that spans more than 100 years.
US braces for '45,000 store closures' Some 45,000 bricks-and-mortar stores could close in the next five years, experts have warned.
Several major retailers have announced store closures or gone out of business altogether in recent years.
Chains such as Foot Locker, Sally Beauty, Tuesday Morning, Shore City, Z Gallerie, and Mitchell Gold + Bob Williams have all gone out of business.
Bed Bath & Beyond has closed all of its brick-and-mortar stores and is now an online-only retailer.
The most affected retailers have been clothing, consumer electronics, sporting goods, hobby, book, music, and home furnishing stores since the start of 2019.
UBS has predicted the total number of retail stores will drop by 45k from 958k to 913k.
Despite that, the report says that certain stores should thrive while others decline.
It said retailers such as Walmart, Costco, Home Depot, and Target, could be among the winners.
But chains with rich histories are not immune to closures.
Macy’s has been part of the American retail landscape since 1858, but bosses are continuing to whittle down its portfolio.
Chiefs have since confirmed they plan to close 65 stores this year , which is more than was initially expected.
Bosses had unveiled a strategy that would see 150 underperforming stores close.
